elements.content: Using similar synthesis conditions and a flexible ligand, 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane (L), we isolated novel right-handed helical infinite chain [Zn(L)(Cl)2] (1), two-dimensional (2D) coordination polymers [M(L)2(H2O)2]·(NO3)2 [M = Zn (2), Cd (3)], and a one-dimensional (1D) double-bridged complex [Cd(L)2(H2O)2]·(ClO4)2(H2O)2 (4), where anions could tune the self-assemblies to form different supramolecular and coordination networks. Compound 1 is the first infinite helix in triazole compounds, where the supramolecular helical chain and the coordination chain form a unique double helical structure. Nitrate and perchlorate anions induced different supramolecular structures, which lead to the first case of the self-assembled CdN4O2 polyhedra from 2D to 1D coordination polymers for 3 and 4, respectively.
elements.clean_text: Using similar synthesis conditions and a flexible ligand, 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane (L), we isolated novel right-handed helical infinite chain [Zn(L)(Cl)2] (1), two-dimensional (2D) coordination polymers [M(L)2(H2O)2]⋅(NO3)2 [M = Zn (2), Cd (3)], and a one-dimensional (1D) double-bridged complex [Cd(L)2(H2O)2]⋅(ClO4)2(H2O)2 (4), where anions could tune the self-assemblies to form different supramolecular and coordination networks. Compound 1 is the first infinite helix in triazole compounds, where the supramolecular helical chain and the coordination chain form a unique double helical structure. Nitrate and perchlorate anions induced different supramolecular structures, which lead to the first case of the self-assembled CdN4O2 polyhedra from 2D to 1D coordination polymers for 3 and 4, respectively.

elements.content: Using various anions in the synthesized systems of 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane and metal ions in aqueous solution, we isolated four novel coordination polymers with three kinds of coordination topologies. Compound 1 is the first infinite helical complex in triazole compounds, which may autoresolve into separate right- and left-handed crystals from the solution.
elements.clean_text: Using various anions in the synthesized systems of 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane and metal ions in aqueous solution, we isolated four novel coordination polymers with three kinds of coordination topologies. Compound 1 is the first infinite helical complex in triazole compounds, which may autoresolve into separate right- and left-handed crystals from the solution.

elements.content: Metal-directed supramolecular self-assembly has produced fascinating results in the last years in two topical areas:  (i) deliberate construction of molecular interlocked/interwined species and polymers, such as catenanes, knots, molecular cages, circular helicates, one-dimensional (1D) helical chains and ladders, two-dimensional (2D) grids, three-dimensional (3D) porous motifs, and interpenetration mode; and (ii) the crystal design and engineering of various topologies with interesting properties in material science. The self-assembly of metal-organic frameworks is highly influenced by factors such as solvent system, template, pH value of solution, geometric requirements of metal ions, and counterions. Therefore, much more work is required to extend our knowledge of the relevant structural types and establish proper synthetic strategies that lead to the desired species with predictable structures and properties. In the past few years, extensive studies have been carried out using rigid bridging ligands such as 4,4‘-bipyridine, 2,4,6-tri(4-pyridyl)-1,3,5-triazine, etc., and a variety of 1D, 2D, and 3D frameworks with novel topologies and inclusion behaviors have been obtained. These rigid polyfunctional ligands are well-known to form grids, rods, bricks, honeycombs, diamondoid nets, and other noteworthy species, while flexible linear ligands may facilitate the formation of helixes and other novel supramolecules. However, bridging ligands with flexible spacers have not been extensively exploited, except for some limited cases.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Metal-directed supramolecular self-assembly has produced fascinating results in the last years in two topical areas: (i) deliberate construction of molecular interlocked/interwined species and polymers, such as catenanes, knots, molecular cages, circular helicates, one-dimensional (1D) helical chains and ladders, two-dimensional (2D) grids, three-dimensional (3D) porous motifs, and interpenetration mode; and (ii) the crystal design and engineering of various topologies with interesting properties in material science. The self-assembly of metal-organic frameworks is highly influenced by factors such as solvent system, template, pH value of solution, geometric requirements of metal ions, and counterions. Therefore, much more work is required to extend our knowledge of the relevant structural types and establish proper synthetic strategies that lead to the desired species with predictable structures and properties. In the past few years, extensive studies have been carried out using rigid bridging ligands such as 4,4‘-bipyridine, 2,4,6-tri(4-pyridyl)-1,3,5-triazine, etc., and a variety of 1D, 2D, and 3D frameworks with novel topologies and inclusion behaviors have been obtained. These rigid polyfunctional ligands are well-known to form grids, rods, bricks, honeycombs, diamondoid nets, and other noteworthy species, while flexible linear ligands may facilitate the formation of helixes and other novel supramolecules. However, bridging ligands with flexible spacers have not been extensively exploited, except for some limited cases.

elements.content: On the other hand, 1,2,4-triazole and its derivatives are very interesting ligands because they combine the coordination geometry of both pyrazoles and imidazoles with regard to the arrangement of their three heteroatoms. A large number of mononuclear, oligonuclear, and polynuclear metal coordination compounds with 1,2,4-triazole derivatives have been prepared and characterized due to their interesting magnetic properties and novel topologies. 1,2-Bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane (L) is a triazole derivative and can adopt gauche (angular) or anti (linear) conformations. Using this flexible triazole ligand, we herein report a series of novel coordination polymers [Zn(L)(Cl)2] (1), [Zn(L)2(H2O)2]·(NO3)2 (2), [Cd(L)2(H2O)2]·(NO3)2 (3), and [Cd(L)2(H2O)2]·(ClO4)2(H2O)2 (4) with helical chains and 1D and 2D networks. All compounds are characterized by elemental analysis and X-ray crystallography.
elements.clean_text: On the other hand, 1,2,4-triazole and its derivatives are very interesting ligands because they combine the coordination geometry of both pyrazoles and imidazoles with regard to the arrangement of their three heteroatoms. A large number of mononuclear, oligonuclear, and polynuclear metal coordination compounds with 1,2,4-triazole derivatives have been prepared and characterized due to their interesting magnetic properties and novel topologies. 1,2-Bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane (L) is a triazole derivative and can adopt gauche (angular) or anti (linear) conformations. Using this flexible triazole ligand, we herein report a series of novel coordination polymers [Zn(L)(Cl)2] (1), [Zn(L)2(H2O)2]⋅(NO3)2 (2), [Cd(L)2(H2O)2]⋅(NO3)2 (3), and [Cd(L)2(H2O)2]⋅(ClO4)2(H2O)2 (4) with helical chains and 1D and 2D networks. All compounds are characterized by elemental analysis and X-ray crystallography.

elements.content: Synthesis. Compound 1 was prepared by refluxing 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane (2.0 mmol) and ZnCl2·2H2O (1.0 mmol) in 15 mL of water solution for 1 h. The precipitate was filtrated, and colorless crystals were isolated from the filtrate within 3 days. Compounds 2−4 were prepared by similar methods of 1 except for using Zn(NO3)2·6H2O, Cd(NO3)2·6H2O, and Cd(ClO4)2·6H2O instead of ZnCl2·2H2O for 2−4, respectively. Yield:  45, 55, 58, and 57% for complexes 1−4, respectively (based on L). Elemental analysis:  found for 1:  C, 23.54; H, 3.01; N, 27.67. For 2:  C, 26.41; H, 3.42; N, 35.46. For 3:  C, 23.78; H, 3.12; N, 32.45. For 4:  C, 20.15; H, 3.58; 23.41. Calcd for 1:  C, 23.96; H, 2.66; N, 27.96. For 2:  C, 26.00; H, 3.61; N, 35.39. For 3:  C, 23.97; H, 3.33; N, 32.62. For 4:  C, 20.23; H, 3.37; N, 23.60.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

 Synthesis. Compound 1 was prepared by refluxing 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane (2.0 mmol) and ZnCl2⋅2H2O (1.0 mmol) in 15 mL of water solution for 1 h. The precipitate was filtrated, and colorless crystals were isolated from the filtrate within 3 days. Compounds 2-4 were prepared by similar methods of 1 except for using Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O, Cd(NO3)2⋅6H2O, and Cd(ClO4)2⋅6H2O instead of ZnCl2⋅2H2O for 2-4, respectively. Yield: 45, 55, 58, and 57% for complexes 1-4, respectively (based on L). Elemental analysis: found for 1: C, 23.54; H, 3.01; N, 27.67. For 2: C, 26.41; H, 3.42; N, 35.46. For 3: C, 23.78; H, 3.12; N, 32.45. For 4: C, 20.15; H, 3.58; 23.41. Calcd for 1: C, 23.96; H, 2.66; N, 27.96. For 2: C, 26.00; H, 3.61; N, 35.39. For 3: C, 23.97; H, 3.33; N, 32.62. For 4: C, 20.23; H, 3.37; N, 23.60.

elements.content: X-ray Crystallography. Diffraction intensities for the four complexes were collected on a computer-controlled Bruker SMART 1000 CCD diffractometer equipped with graphite-monochromated Mo Kα radiation with a radiation wavelength 0.71073 Å by using the ω-scan technique. Lorentz polarization and absorption corrections were applied. The structures were solved by direct methods and refined with the full-matrix least-squares technique using the SHELXS-97 and SHELXL-97 programs. Anisotropic thermal parameters were assigned to all nonhydrogen atoms. The hydrogen atoms were set in calculated positions and refined as riding atoms with a common fixed isotropic thermal parameter. Analytical expressions of neutral-atom scattering factors were employed, and anomalous dispersion corrections were incorporated. The crystallographic data and selected bond lengths and angles for 1−4 are listed in Tables and , respectively. CCDC reference numbers 249979 (1), 249978 (2), 249976 (3), and 249977 (4) contain the supplementary crystallographic data for this contribution. These data can be obtained free of charge via www.ccdc.can.ac.uk/conts/retrieving.html (or from the Cambridge Crystallographic Centre).

Analytical expressions of neutral-atom scattering factors were employed, and anomalous dispersion corrections were incorporated. The crystallographic data and selected bond lengths and angles  for 1-4 are listed in Tables  and , respectively. CCDC reference numbers 249979 (1), 249978 (2), 249976 (3), and 249977 (4) contain the supplementary crystallographic data for this contribution. These data can be obtained free of charge via www.ccdc.can.ac.uk/conts/retrieving.html (or from the Cambridge Crystallographic Centre).

For 1:  −x, −y, z + 1/2; −y + 1/2, x + 1/2, z + 1/4; y + 1/2, −x + 1/2, z + 3/4; −x + 1/2, y + 1/2, −z + 1/4; x + 1/2, −y + 1/2, −z + 3/4; −y, −x, −z + 1/2. For 2:  −x, y + 1/2, −z + 1/2; −x, −y, −z; x, −y − 1/2, z − 1/2. For 3:  −x, y + 1/2, −z + 1/2; −x, −y, −z; x, −y − 1/2, z − 1/2. For 4:  −x, −y, −z.

The single-crystal analysis of 1 reveals that the metal ion is four-coordinated completed via two L and two chloride atoms (the Cl atoms are disordered) (Figure ). Linked by L ligands, zinc(II) ions are arranged in single right-handed helical chains (Figure ). The width of the helix is calculated to be 8.3 Å, and the pitch is 12.3 Å, containing two Zn(II) ions per turn. The helical chain has two Zn···Zn distances of 10.42 and 12.32 Å. The stability of the final helical structure relies on the coordination bonds together with Cl···H−C hydrogen bonds. Compound 1 is the first infinite helical complex in triazole compounds.
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

The single-crystal analysis of 1 reveals that the metal ion is four-coordinated completed via two L and two chloride atoms (the Cl atoms are disordered) (Figure ). Linked by L ligands, zinc(II) ions are arranged in single right-handed helical chains (Figure ). The width of the helix is calculated to be 8.3 Å, and the pitch is 12.3 Å, containing two Zn(II) ions per turn. The helical chain has two Zn⋅⋅⋅Zn distances of 10.42 and 12.32 Å. The stability of the final helical structure relies on the coordination bonds together with Cl⋅⋅⋅H-C hydrogen bonds. Compound 1 is the first infinite helical complex in triazole compounds.

elements.content: Coordination unit of1.
elements.clean_text: 1  Coordination unit of1.

elements.content: When we used nitrate anions [Zn(NO3)2 and Cd(NO3)2] instead of chloride anions, we isolated two two-dimensional grids, compounds 2 and 3. Each M(II) is bonded equatorially to four nitrogen atoms of different L ligands and two water molecules in the axial sites (Figure ). Four metal ions and four L ligands construct a metallic cycle along two different directions as building blocks in the network. Both structures consist of 2D neutral coordination networks constructed via M(L)2(H2O)2 units as shown in Figure (M = Zn and Cd). As compared with the Zn−O and Zn−N bond lengths in 2, the Cd−O and Cd−N bond lengths in 3 are larger, which is due to the greater ionic radii of metallic centers.
elements.clean_text: When we used nitrate anions [Zn(NO3)2 and Cd(NO3)2] instead of chloride anions, we isolated two two-dimensional grids, compounds 2 and 3. Each M(II) is bonded equatorially to four nitrogen atoms of different L ligands and two water molecules in the axial sites (Figure ). Four metal ions and four L ligands construct a metallic cycle along two different directions as building blocks in the network. Both structures consist of 2D neutral coordination networks constructed via M(L)2(H2O)2 units as shown in Figure  (M = Zn and Cd). As compared with the Zn-O and Zn-N bond lengths in 2,  the Cd-O and Cd-N bond lengths in 3 are larger, which is due to the greater ionic radii of metallic centers.

elements.content: Complex 4 contains a 1D chain linked via double L bridges (Figure ). Each Cd is six-coordinated by four nitrogens of different L ligands and two water molecules in axial sites. Two Cd ions and two L ligands construct a metallic cycle as the based building block of the 1D chain. It is noted that both 3 and 4 have the same CdN4O2 polyhedra as fundamental units. As compared with 3, the bond lengths in the polyhedra are similar while the N−Cd−N bond angles are different (90.67 and 89.33° in 3 and 93.96 and 86.05° in 4, respectively), which is due to the stronger repulsion between L ligands in 4. To our knowledge, this is the first report of structural transformation from 2D to 1D coordination polymers induced by different uncoordinated anions in the self-assembly system.
elements.clean_text: Complex 4 contains a 1D chain linked via double L bridges (Figure ). Each Cd is six-coordinated by four nitrogens of different L ligands and two water molecules in axial sites. Two Cd ions and two L ligands construct a metallic cycle as the based building block of the 1D chain. It is noted that both 3 and 4 have the same CdN4O2 polyhedra as fundamental units. As compared with 3, the bond lengths in the polyhedra are similar while the N-Cd-N bond angles are different (90.67 and 89.33° in 3 and 93.96 and 86.05° in 4, respectively), which is due to the stronger repulsion between L ligands in 4. To our knowledge, this is the first report of structural transformation from 2D to 1D coordination polymers induced by different uncoordinated anions in the self-assembly system.

elements.content: From the viewpoint of supramolecular chemistry, complexes 1−4 exhibit various topologies constructed via hydrogen bonds, which help stabilize the pack and induce the assembly of coordination networks.
elements.clean_text: From the viewpoint of supramolecular chemistry, complexes 1-4 exhibit various topologies constructed via hydrogen bonds, which help stabilize the pack and induce the assembly of coordination networks.

elements.content: In 1, Cl···H−C (2.819 Å) interactions play an important role in forming and stabilizing the coordinated helical chains. Both the right-handed helical supramolecular chain and the coordination chain interwine with each other along the c direction to form a unique double helical configuration (Figure ), which act as a foundational block to further construct the 3D supramolecular pack of 1 (Figure ). Double helical compounds always contain the same coordination, supramolecular, or covalent chains, and we found the unique double helical chains constructed via both coordination and supramolecular chains. It is noted that the nonchiral ligand and metal ion may not be possible to produce a helical structure that is exclusively right-handed or left-handed, which always results in a racemic mixture of right- and left-handed helical products. The unusual compound 1 may have autoresolved into separate right- and left-handed crystals from the solution.
elements.clean_text: In 1, Cl⋅⋅⋅H-C (2.819 Å) interactions play an important role in forming and stabilizing the coordinated helical chains. Both the right-handed helical supramolecular chain and the coordination chain interwine with each other along the c direction to form a unique double helical configuration (Figure ), which act as a foundational block to further construct the 3D supramolecular pack of 1 (Figure ). Double helical compounds always contain the same coordination, supramolecular, or covalent chains, and we found the unique double helical chains constructed via both coordination and supramolecular chains. It is noted that the nonchiral ligand and metal ion may not be possible to produce a helical structure that is exclusively right-handed or left-handed, which always results in a racemic mixture of right- and left-handed helical products. The unusual compound 1 may have autoresolved into separate right- and left-handed crystals from the solution.

elements.content: Double helical structure of coordinated chain and supramolecular chain along the side (up) and axis (down-right) directions in1. Green, Cl; blue, N; cyan, Zn; gray, C; white, H; red dot, hydrogen bond; ted chain, supramolecular helix; and blue chain, coordinated chain.
elements.clean_text: 6  Double helical structure of coordinated chain and supramolecular chain along the side (up) and axis (down-right) directions in1. Green, Cl; blue, N; cyan, Zn; gray, C; white, H; red dot, hydrogen bond; ted chain, supramolecular helix; and blue chain, coordinated chain.

elements.content: In 2 and 3, nitrate anions and coordination waters are alternatively linked by hydrogen bonds to form 1D zigzag supramolecular chains (Figure ). These chains are further linked via M−O bonds to form supramolecular grids, which depend on the coordination grids in the compounds. Although both complexes have the same supramolecular network, due to different ionic radii of Zn(II) and Cd(II), the hydrogen bond lengths in 2 are slightly longer than those in 3 (2.752 and 2.965 Å in 2 and 2.723 and 2.892 Å in 3).

These chains are further linked via M-O bonds to form supramolecular grids, which depend on the coordination grids in the compounds. Although both complexes have the  same supramolecular network, due to different ionic radii of Zn(II) and Cd(II), the hydrogen bond lengths in 2 are slightly longer than those in 3 (2.752 and 2.965 Å in 2 and 2.723 and 2.892 Å in 3).

elements.content: In 4, coordination water and solvent water form water dimmers, which are further linked by ClO4 - anions to form a supramolecular cycle (Figure ). These cycles link the 1D chains to form a 2D supramolecule. The precise structure of the near linear (H2O)2 in 4 will help us understand better the structure and behavior of water molecules. As compared with 3, the different anions induced different supramolecular assemblies in 4, which may be the main reason of self-assembly of CdN4O2 polyhedra from 2D to 1D for 3 and 4, respectively.

These cycles link the 1D chains to form a 2D supramolecule. The precise structure of the near linear (H2O)2 in 4 will help us understand better the structure and behavior of water molecules. As compared with 3, the different anions induced different supramolecular assemblies in 4, which may be the main reason of self-assembly of CdN4O2 polyhedra from 2D to 1D for 3 and 4, respectively.

elements.clean_text: 9  Supramolecular network in4. Red, O; yellow, Cl; green, Cd; red dot, hydrogen bond; gray line, coordinated or covalent bond; and green dot, 1D coordinated chain in 4.

elements.content: Complexes 2−4 demonstrate some principles of multiple interaction self-assembly. For example, the requirements of the stronger interactions (coordination bonds) are clearly satisfied before the weaker ones (hydrogen bonds). The coordination units about the metal ions in compounds 2−4 are identical; however, the hydrogen-bonded supramolecular structures are different. The coordination bonds are most likely formed in a dynamic equilibrium in solution, with one of the possible polymeric arrangements being abstracted into the solid state through formation of the hydrogen bonds in the crystal lattice.
elements.clean_text: Complexes 2-4 demonstrate some principles of multiple interaction self-assembly. For example, the requirements of the stronger interactions (coordination bonds) are clearly satisfied before the weaker ones (hydrogen bonds). The coordination units about the metal ions in compounds 2-4 are identical; however, the hydrogen-bonded supramolecular structures are different. The coordination bonds are most likely formed in a dynamic equilibrium in solution, with one of the possible polymeric arrangements being abstracted into the solid state through formation of the hydrogen bonds in the crystal lattice.

elements.content:
<fig id="cg0495871h00001" position="float">
<label></label>
<graphic xlink:href="cg-2004-09587+_0011.tif"></graphic>
</fig>

In conclusion, using various anions in the synthesized systems of L and metal ions in aqueous, we isolated four novel coordination polymers with three kinds of coordination topologies (Scheme 1). Cl- and NO3 - anions induced the formation of four- and six-coordinated Zn(II) ions and further assembled to 1D helical chains for 1 and (4,4) 2D grids for 2. NO3 - and ClO4 - anions could tune 2D to 1D coordination polymers from 3 to 4. Compound 1 is the first infinite helical complex in triazole compounds, which could be significant in terms of the potential applications in chiral catalysis and optical materials.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

In conclusion, using various anions in the synthesized systems of L and metal ions in aqueous, we isolated four novel coordination polymers with three kinds of coordination topologies (Scheme 1). Cl- and NO3 - anions induced the formation of four- and six-coordinated Zn(II) ions and further assembled to 1D helical chains for 1 and (4,4) 2D grids for 2. NO3 - and ClO4 - anions could tune 2D to 1D coordination polymers from 3 to 4. Compound 1 is the first infinite helical complex in triazole compounds, which could be significant in terms of the potential applications in chiral catalysis and optical materials.

cln_elements.content: Synthesis. Compound 1 was prepared by refluxing 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane (2.0 mmol) and ZnCl2·2H2O (1.0 mmol) in 15 mL of water solution for 1 h. The precipitate was filtrated, and colorless crystals were isolated from the filtrate within 3 days. Compounds 2−4 were prepared by similar methods of 1 except for using Zn(NO3)2·6H2O, Cd(NO3)2·6H2O, and Cd(ClO4)2·6H2O instead of ZnCl2·2H2O for 2−4, respectively. Yield:  45, 55, 58, and 57% for complexes 1−4, respectively (based on L). Elemental analysis:  found for 1:  C, 23.54; H, 3.01; N, 27.67. For 2:  C, 26.41; H, 3.42; N, 35.46. For 3:  C, 23.78; H, 3.12; N, 32.45. For 4:  C, 20.15; H, 3.58; 23.41. Calcd for 1:  C, 23.96; H, 2.66; N, 27.96. For 2:  C, 26.00; H, 3.61; N, 35.39. For 3:  C, 23.97; H, 3.33; N, 32.62. For 4:  C, 20.23; H, 3.37; N, 23.60.
cln_elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

 Synthesis. Compound 1 was prepared by refluxing 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)ethane (2.0 mmol) and ZnCl2⋅2H2O (1.0 mmol) in 15 mL of water solution for 1 h. The precipitate was filtrated, and colorless crystals were isolated from the filtrate within 3 days. Compounds 2-4 were prepared by similar methods of 1 except for using Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O, Cd(NO3)2⋅6H2O, and Cd(ClO4)2⋅6H2O instead of ZnCl2⋅2H2O for 2-4, respectively. Yield: 45, 55, 58, and 57% for complexes 1-4, respectively (based on L). Elemental analysis: found for 1: C, 23.54; H, 3.01; N, 27.67. For 2: C, 26.41; H, 3.42; N, 35.46. For 3: C, 23.78; H, 3.12; N, 32.45. For 4: C, 20.15; H, 3.58; 23.41. Calcd for 1: C, 23.96; H, 2.66; N, 27.96. For 2: C, 26.00; H, 3.61; N, 35.39. For 3: C, 23.97; H, 3.33; N, 32.62. For 4: C, 20.23; H, 3.37; N, 23.60.

cln_elements.content: Single right-handed helical chain of1 along side (left) and axis (right) directions. Blue, N; gray, C; and cyan, Zn. H and Cl atoms were omitted for clarity.
